column5: Well Cliff I can't wait till lakair so I can go in your boat put my feet up and kick back while you drive the boat lol.Fi Carole allows me in HER boat
Ah Shawn I was already in the LUND club   Shawn
Yes Tracker its a Tiller I try to stay clear of those winnebago boats that get skunked in the BOQ alot
Brian 2 of you would be cramped in that boat lol.Actually with the wide open floor I will have more room than the SSV.  The live well is all those big uns

Ya I looked into all that Mike but I wanted IPS Hull livewell,lockable rod storage and lots of storage ask Percher I bring more stuff in the boat than anyone he knows.If you ever ride in a Classic you may change your mind about an SSV.
Nah Roy why bother with yellow when I can invite Papa Smurf in Blue to fish with me
Congrats mike,,,,must be a great feeling,,,nothing like that day when ya go pick it up and the next when your fishing out of it thinking,,,wow,,i love this boat!!!
Nice boat Mike, Lund s a quality boat, hope you have lots of fun in i!
I'm not sure if you're allowed in the boat, but if you are... I know you sure as hell aint allowed to touch the net!!!
Boy I have to watch what I say around you dog
Mike le brochet  Belle bateau - bon pour quinte.  David aka  Superdad
Sweet boat Mike. That should really fly with the 50hp on it. Watch out fishies ........ here comes the "pike slayer".
Very nice Mike and good luck with it.

I think you are one of the few people affected by 2-foot-itis.... but in the opposite direction  The increased beam will always be more noticeable than the length...but any woman could have told you that  I hope that I'm the next one posting pics of their new ride...soon I tell ya!  Tony
Nice Boat!  Remember, it's not the length, but the girth ... and how you use it that really counts.  Hehe.  Awesome.  Bet you can't wait to get out!  You will love the stability of that boat's width.
awesome ride....only about 8 weeks left till you can fish champlain for lakers
Hey nice boat!!  We can have a race when I go to Mohawk Bay in May (I'm trying for the 24th & 25th)
nice boat

Lund 1660 Classic    This is the 1775 Classic which I did NOT purchase but it shows the colour I selected.    Well it was only a matter of time .Today I went out and bought the boat I wanted A new Lund 1660 Classic Grey with black decals.I did keep my motor from the SSV a 50hp Honda  I will miss my SSV 18 foot Lund.Had some good times in her she did see some pretty big waves in the 4 summers I had her.     Finally I have storage,livewell,and a bow mount electric motor .Bass fishin will be much easier.Added some toys like tunes and a GPS fish finder combo.this will be 2ft 3 inches shorter than the SSV but 11 inches wider.  Lets just say after fishing in Percher's boat, my friend Kenny's boat and seeing fishin Devils Lund Classics. I had to Have one.And yes Greencoachdog its a TILLER.Keep yer side Console to yourself  MTP
I really like the size of that boat. AND it will boogie with that motor. Congrats
It's not always length that's the ticket Mike! That wider beam will be great on the BOQ.
congrats on the new vessel
nice boat bud  dang, I am slipping behind on the toy list seems I am needing to buy a new boat to keep up
WOOHOO Mike!   Great looking boat!  Cant wait to fish in her with ya!! haha.  Now when you go and get skunked, at least you'll look good in the boat....LOL
Beauty.....love the layout on that one. WIDE open!  I have a feeling your not going to miss the ssv too much  Sinker
Congrats Mike... Hope ya can catch your share of fish in her...
Congrats on the sweet new ride mike.
congrats on the new ride
Beauty Lund, can't beat it.  I got a 1625 w/40 merc two yrs back and really enjoy it.  Tons of room and very stable, even fished four guys out of it this year with no problems.   Enjoy  Greg
Hey Mike - Congrates on the new ride! ( but your missing the steering wheel! )   Don
These guys look a little cramped in the 16'er. By the way, why do you need a livewell? Congrats Mike! -Brian
Very nice boat mike you will have a lot of good days in it  rob

Sweet boat Mike, but you know for the price of some marine plywood, carpeting, some hatch covers a small bilge pump and some elbow grease you could've retrofitted the SSV the way you wanted. (I love the SSV's, big fan  ). Did you trade it in? If not I'd be happy to take it off your hands!
nice boat but its a TILLER ...... no really nice boat its to cold to start the old tiller /console post.  Happy fishing Mike   Art
You couldn't find a yellow one....with a beak?
WTG Mike, very purdy boat !!  I'll get a better look at it on Quinte this  May
Nice boat Mike, congrats bud  Joey
Nice boat Mike, she looks nice and wide and deep.  Congrats.
Really nice boat Mike.... congrats...

Operating a boat from the transom?... How primitive!!!  It does look and sound like a real nice boat, even if it doesn't have a steering wheel. The creature comforts will add to the enjoyment, and maybe... just maybe... help you catch a fish!  Did you get the Humminbird?    He needs the livewell to keep the minnow buckets in Brian!
CONGRATS MIKE !!!!!!.  ..welcome to the classic lund club buddy..  ...nice fishin machine ....cheers
if you get skunked in a lund what more could ask for great boat
Its not my fault Mike so stop telling the wife that.Congrats you will love it. Dan
